description:
Full Job Description
Ramp is building the modern financial stack that enables companies to accelerate growth without compromising on their finances. We’re on a mission to uncover and eliminate waste before it undermines our customer’s goals. We make financial rigor easy by enabling real-time visibility and understanding of every dollar spent.

Ramp was founded by the same team who built, scaled, and sold Paribus to Capital One, enabling automated savings on online purchases and putting over $100 million back in consumers’ pockets every year. We are backed by Founders Fund, Coatue, and Box Group, as well as over 50 founders of leading companies.

About the Role

Ramp is, at its core, an engineering company, and is on a mission to build the best engineering team in NYC! We are looking for frontend and full stack engineering interns (12 weeks) who are excited to be part of our early story and help us build a diverse and vibrant tech community in the city. We hire engineers with a broad set of technical skills, who are highly cross-functional, and eager to solve a wide range of engineering challenges. Our ideal candidate has a strong sense of ownership and enjoys owning projects from inception to scaling it in production. We value people who take pride in their work, and show an aptitude for learning quickly whether they’re familiar with our stack or not. As an early employee, you'll be working with a nimble team of committed and talented engineers and having a large, long-term impact on technical design and engineering culture.

What You'll Do

Build performant, beautiful, and usable interfaces that solve for growing businesses with complex needs
Ship products and services in cross-functional teams
Work with sales and business teams to incorporate and productize customer feedback
Help establish engineering process, tools, and systems that will allow us to scale the code base, productivity, and the team

What You'll Need

Currently pursuing a B.S. (or higher) in Computer Science or a related technical field, with an expected graduation date in 2021 or 2022
Proficiency in Javascript, with a knack for getting the visuals right
Experience with one or more object-oriented programming languages
Track record of shipping high quality products and features or a portfolio of side projects
Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft
Alignment with Ramp’s core values of enabling businesses to grow more by spending less

Nice to Haves

Proficiency in React v16+
Familiarity with or desire to learn our tech stack which includes, but not limited to: Flask (Python), Elixir, AWS, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL
Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology

About Our Teams

Card Engineering | Ramp’s Card Engineering team is responsible for shipping products with a singular focus on enhancing the finance team and cardholder experience. Current project areas include accounting, physical/virtual card management, mobile wallets, transactions, reimbursements, spend insights, and vendor/invoice management.
Risk Engineering | Ramp’s Risk Engineering team is pioneering how risk is evaluated and building the infrastructure to scale to millions of business in the United States. Current project areas include application processing, underwriting & KYC, risk data signals, risk limit & exposure management, bank linking, capital markets, fraud, and payments.

Learn more about our problem space and environment at our new engineering blog - https://engineering.ramp.com

Ramp Benefits

Unlimited PTO
WFH stipend to support your home office needs
Monthly wellness stipend

Full Job Description

Software Developer Intern

The Opportunity
Applied Software Inc. also known as MagView (http://www.magview.com) is a growing proprietary health software company that has a stable track record of growth in its niche market. We deliver quality software solutions to hospitals and breast centers across the nation that helps save lives. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, an independent worker, polished, and have good communication skills. A positive attitude with the ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced and fluid work environment is imperative for this role. Strong attention to detail, flexibility, and interpersonal astuteness are key factors for the position.

The Role
This intern will be immersed in the environment of a professional health software firm and see what it is like to work in an office environment. You will help by providing programming support to the development group. Applicants should have excellent analytical and math skills, with the ability to work in teams. We are looking for students majoring in Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering or Mathematics ideally.

Responsibilities

  • Develop software as assigned (coding, programming)
  • Document/create/maintain automation tests, performance tests, procedures, records, and data.
  • Strong communication and documentation, organizational, and problem-solving skills
  • Help analyze and diagnose performance, functional software, and customer issues.
  • Work closely with development engineers during product development life cycles and be involved in early field trials of release candidates.
  • Work with development team members to understand and communicate defects.
  • Flexibility to move across projects as needed.
  • Documentation and testing new software functionality.

Experience & Skills Requirements

  • Ability to write well-documented code (C#, Java, or other OO Language), and provide detailed user and developer documentation
  • Ability to write comprehensive defect reports.
  • Ability to create and maintain testing data.
  • Ability to create and adhere to test design standards.
  • Excellent customer service orientation and teamwork skills.
  • Must have a working knowledge of client/server environments and personal computer hardware and software.
  • Experience with MS SQL preferred.
  • Experience in problem resolution support, system analysis, healthcare IT or HL7 preferred
  • Positive, serving attitude with enthusiasm and passion that infects every call, meeting, and room you join

Majors

Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics

Salary Range: This is a flexible schedule paid internship opportunity with pay that will commensurate with experience. We are looking for someone who is looking to grow into full-time development opportunity. Please include salary requirement with your resume.

ASI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages applicants of all ages, experiences, and backgrounds to apply for open positions. ASI does not discriminate on the basis an applicant’s age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, or status with regard to public assistance. ASI offers a competitive salary and a positive corporate culture. For more information about the ASI team, please visit our website at: https://www.magview.com/careers/.

Please apply here: https://www.magview.com/software-developer-intern-form/

description:
Full Job Description

Minecraft, Roblox, Guru

$12 to $15 per hour

Urgently hiring
Build your resume and use your skills this summer by inspiring kids to create and code unique video games.

We are looking for someone who has experience teaching games using the Minecraft or Roblox gaming platform, enjoys teaching kids, and has strong coding skills, to help us design our Roblox Coding Curriculum. The initial project will be about 2-3 months which includes helping us create a curriculum on Roblox for elementary/middle school students. You will be joining a team of educators who are passionate about creating project-based and inquiry-based computer science courses for kids. Your responsibility:

Teach kids the things you love and watch them reach their potential as you give them the keys to cutting-edge technology. Our kids are highly motivated and responsive!

  • Create the Roblox/MInecraft curriculum and design additional sessions
  • Teach kids how to create their own Escape Room.
  • Create the materials used in classes
  • Build new games as well as instructions
  • Deliver the class directly to students in person, must be vaccinated.
  • Passionate about education and teaching technologies
  • Previous experience in working with school-aged kids
  • Strong interests in technology, computers, and building games
  • Enjoy playing and have experience with developing games in the Roblox gaming platform or Unity and Minecraft
  • Be able to pass a background check
  • Authorized to work in the US
  • Have a passion for creative kids who are allowed to use new ideas.
  • Previous experiences in developing computer science curriculum
  • Previous experience teaching how to develop games in Minecraft/Roblox to children

Full Job Description
The Construction and Engineering Global Business Unit (CEGBU) of Oracle is the world’s leading project and portfolio management software organization. Since 1983, we have provided the software foundation that enables all types of businesses to achieve excellence in managing their portfolios, programs, projects and resources. The development group in the CEGBU is focused on developing enterprise-level solutions for our customers in project- intensive industries worldwide. We leverage agile development methods to facilitate the development of our products; our practices include empowered teams, continuous build and integration, regular reviews, and a heavy emphasis on testing early and often. We offer a highly collaborative and dynamic environment, as well as a great mix of project management and software engineering opportunities.

Oracle Primavera Cloud Site - >
https://www.oracle.com/industries/construction-engineering/primavera-cloud-project-management/

Oracle Primavera Cloud Datasheet - >
https://www.oracle.com/a/ocom/docs/oracle-primavera-cloud-ds.pdf

Working as part of a development team, you will be called upon to analyze problems, suggest and assess multiple alternative solutions, and develop high-quality industry leading software. BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field, is required. The ability to work effectively in a fast-paced team environment is essential. Ideal candidates have a passion for the software development field and actively stay on top of technology trends and best practices. An Applications Engineer works as part of a cross-functional development team to deliver the next releases of our enterprise project and portfolio management products. Ability to quickly grasp and communicate technical, business, and design information is preferred. Need to understand and experience with one (or both) of the following technology areas:

  • Java (core and EE), object-oriented design, design patterns
  • JavaScript, functional programming, and popular web libraries
Do you want to get a foot in the door and perhaps even get the chance to interview early for one of the best technology jobs in the world? If so, you may be an ideal candidate for our internship program.

Gain invaluable experience in what it is like to work at a leading global hardware and software systems innovator - Oracle. Your colleagues are industry experts and knowledgeable veterans. Your contributions will enhance real Oracle products and services. By the end of your internship you will be connected to a powerful network of professionals, managers, and executives.

Completed third year of undergraduate degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or related area of study. Strong academic achievement. Strong interest in technical area of study.If you are a Colorado resident, Please

Contact us

or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 107011 in the subject line of the email.
Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. position: High School SRI - Human-Earth Systems Sci:Develop Intern [Remote] Academic
description:
Full Job Description
Organization and Job ID

Job ID: 312166

Directorate: Earth and Biological Sciences

Division: Joint Global Change Research Institute

Group: Human-Earth Systems Science: Development

Job Description

Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is seeking ambitious, high-caliber junior or senior high school students for intern assignment within the High School Student Research Intern (HS SRI) Program. This internship provides an opportunity for students interested in preparing for careers in science, technology, engineering or mathematics (STEM - or Computer Science) to work during the academic year with a scientist/mentor in a specified research area. Students attend regular classes in their school for one-half day.

The student's primary area of work will be with an existing database on soil respiration (the natural flow of CO2 from the soil to atmosphere) studies made worldwide. After an extensive orientation period, the student will update the database with recently-published data. This is more than simple data entry and requires careful reading and checking in collaboration with the two primary mentors, Dr. Ben Bond-Lamberty and Ms. Stephanie Pennington. Work later in this year will branch out to R programming and data visualization.

  • BEFORE YOU APPLY*
When asked to upload your resume to your application, you need to upload one (1) PDF file that includes the following:

Cover Letter

Resume

Unofficial transcript

Personal Statement: Describe who you are beyond your academic achievements and potential. Offer information in regards to what kind of activities, leadership or experiences you’ve had that contributed toward your interest in STEM.

APPLICATIONS THAT DO NOT INCLUDE THE ITEMS ABOVE IN THEIR SINGLE PDF UPLOAD WILL BE DISQUALIFIED AS INCOMPLETE.

Minimum Qualifications

Applicants must be currently enrolled as a sophomore, junior, or senior in a public or private high school.

Applicants must be 16 years of age by August 2021.

Applicants must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher (from beginning of 9th grade to current standing).

Preferred Qualifications

Relevant Course Work - Background in high school earth sciences and computer science.

Computer Skills Desired - Programming experience at a high school level.

Other Desired Skills - Good communication skills. C++, R, and/or Git experience is useful.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Battelle Memorial Institute (BMI) at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and supports diversity in the workplace. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital or family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. All BMI staff must be able to demonstrate the legal right to work in the United States. BMI is an E-Verify employer. Learn more at jobs.pnnl.gov.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via https://jobs.pnnl.gov/help.stm

Please be aware that the Department of Energy (DOE) prohibits DOE employees and contractors from having any affiliation with the foreign government of a country DOE has identified as a “country of risk” without explicit approval by DOE and Battelle. If you are offered a position at PNNL and currently have any affiliation with the government of one of these countries you will be required to disclose this information and recuse yourself of that affiliation or receive approval from DOE and Battelle prior to your first day of employment.

Directorate: Earth & Biological Sciences

Job Category: Undergraduate Internships

Group: Human-Earth Sys Sci: Analysis

Closing Date: 2021-06-08

In addition to engineering services, UMP provides tooling collaboration, design and build, value added assembly, heat treating and finish operations.

Full Job Description

IT Intern

It’s a challenge, and an invitation. Most importantly, it’s an opportunity to join an industry leader.There’s never been a better time to work at Generac. We’re shaping the market and investing in new companies and new technologies. Our rapid growth equals rapid career advancement opportunities for those who want to be challenged and enjoy a fast-paced, high-performance culture.

JOB SUMMARY: The IT Technician Intern is responsible for assisting the IT team a wide range of duties including network consolidation, inventorying and organizing server hardware equipment, and completing computer imaging and lifecycle swaps. This internship is full-time Monday-Friday and will run until early/mid-August.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Complete Network consolidation and documentation including floorplan
  • Conduct and document complete server and hardware inventory, identifying equipment that is not in use and initiating the e-cycle process
  • Organize cables, including updating labels
  • Transcribe physical inventory into Excel sheet
  • Complete computer imaging
  • Assist with lifecycle swaps/profile migrations

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Microsoft Office proficiency with strong aptitude in Excel
  • Strong familiarity with Visio and/or other CAD based software
  • Windows 10 OS advanced control and configuration
  • The ability to problem solve technical and logistical issues.
  • Willingness and desire tp constantly learn new things
  • General knowledge of Networks (TCP/IP)
  • Conscientious self-motivated worker with an attention to detail
  • Sophomore year status or higher
  • Currently enrolled in an Associates or Bachelor's program with an emphasis in Computer Science or related major

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job include are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus.

About DR Power

Originally Incorporated as "Dick Raymond's Country Home Products"​ in 1985, our company's first product was the Dick Raymond Work/Rest Wagon. Two years later, the DR Trimmer Mower ushered in an all-new category in outdoor power equipment. We are passionate about innovative, high quality design and we appreciate good tools that are durable, simple and useful. We only offer products we use ourselves, each one vigorously tested for performance and durability, described truthfully, and guaranteed to be one of the best quality and value available. It’s more than just a pay check and a comfy chair around here. We keep it fun! It’s a huge testament to how satisfied our employees are that have been named among the Best Places to Work in Vermont for the 8 times by the Best Companies Group. This list is compiled based on confidential employee surveys, and we are extremely proud of how positively our employees rate us. And don’t worry if you’re not a power equipment aficionado. While many of our employees live the country lifestyle and know their way around a log splitter before the even set foot in our office, many learn the ins and outs once they get here. No sweat either way. We’re more interested in your initiative and attitude than how many types of lawn mower you can name. We respect our customers and each other. That’s how we’ve created such a sought-after work environment — one that continually attracts the very best professional people. The kind of people who care about the company they work for, the job they do and the customers they serve. If you are interested in joining our team, visit us at www.drpower.com/careers

Full Job Description

Department: Information Technology
Location: Orlando, FL
Reports to: Director of Project Management and Interns
Peers: IT Support Specialist, IT Systems Analyst
Exemption Status: Non-Exempt

Who You Are

First, you're a committed Christian who wants to use your technical skills to serve the Lord. You are also an aspiring IT technician who likes to solve problems and learn new things. You enjoy helping people use technology and you have the patience required when the solutions are hard to find. You enjoy the feeling that comes with helping people get back to work after their computer gives them trouble. You aren’t afraid to own a technology upgrade project from start to finish.

Who We Are

The Job You'll Do

What We'll Do For You

Your Skills

*

*

Full Job Description
Applecart is a high growth marketing technology company based in New York City, founded in 2013. Applecart has developed a proprietary social graph platform that uses publicly available data to map over 25 billion social relationships between more than 250 million adult Americans. Applecart's platform helps major corporations, national nonprofit organizations, and high-profile political campaigns with their highest stakes marketing challenge: reaching hard-to-reach audiences of decision makers, spanning corporate executives, legislators, regulators, investors, members of the media, and more.

For years, marketing technology businesses have focused on solving b2c (consumer) marketing challenges (e.g. look-a-like modeling to find new customers), but the traditional pay-per-impression advertising model has left a massive opportunity unsolved for: how to market when a company's target isn't the average consumer, but is instead a single, senior decision maker. Applecart is the solution to this problem for some of the world's most prominent organizations.

Quick facts about us:
Applecart has generated over $30M in revenue, with annual revenues in excess of $10M.

Our senior leadership team includes two members of the 2021 Forbes 30 under 30 list for Marketing and Advertising, a former senior White House advisor, one of the earliest sales leaders at Google and Twitter, and two of the Democratic Party's most successful pollsters and strategists

Our investors include global sports, entertainment and marketing giant Endeavor, KKR Co-Chairman and Co-CEO Henry Kravis, entrepreneur Chris Burch, a founder of Palantir, senior engineering leaders at Twitter and Yelp, past CEOs of Fortune 50 companies and a number of well-known venture capitalists. Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel is a board member of the company.

Current and past clients include Blackstone, Boeing, KKR, the Environmental Defense Fund, the Business Roundtable, Governor John Kasich, Congressman Conor Lamb and Republican Voters Against Trump.

Our work has been featured on Morning Joe on MSNBC, Bloomberg and The Colbert Report, and in Axios, BusinessWeek, the Associated Press, Forbes, the Washington Post, and Politico, among many others.

About the Role

We are looking for creative, self-motivated, flexible thinkers to join our team as a Data Analyst Intern . Working with Applecart's political strategists, data analysts, and data scientists, the Data Analyst Fellow will contribute to targeting, analytics, and polling efforts on behalf of some of the country's most prominent trade associations, political campaigns, non-profits, independent expenditure efforts, and corporations.

About the Role

We are looking for creative, self-motivated, flexible thinkers to join our rapidly growing start-up as an Analyst Intern. Working with Applecart's political strategists, data analysts, and data scientists, you will assume meaningful responsibilities to help meet client needs, execute on their own research projects, and play a large role in helping our clients win campaigns.

What You Will Do

Assist in general, ongoing campaign activities
Explore Applecart's current and past projects to produce analyses and associated learnings
Build insight-rich reports for both our clients and internally within the company
Draft political polls to effectively measure public opinion about specific issues or candidates
Assist in the development of proposal and pitch materials for prospective clients
Build case studies of current and past campaign successes
Research developments in political news, political science (including research into political candidates, the histories of certain political geographies, and the academic literature of modern political campaigns), and political polling
Develop your technical skills and gain a deeper understanding of statistics

Education and Experience

You are currently enrolled in, or a recent graduate from, a BA/BS or MA/MS program at a four-year college or university in political science, public policy, statistics, computer science, economics, or a related field
You have previously worked on a small team and successfully completed time-sensitive, detail-oriented projects

Qualifications

You work well with a small team in a fast-paced, self-motivated environment
You have exceptionally strong written and verbal communication skills
You maintain a particularly sharp attention to detail
You are comfortable and confident in problem-solving as a team and autonomously
You have a passion for American politics and an interest in the nuts and bolts of political campaigns; self-proclaimed political junkies welcome!

You are open to working with solutions-oriented candidates and causes on both sides of the political aisle
You want to understand and execute using data-driven decision making

Preferred Qualifications

You have worked on a political campaign or conducted political research
You have quantitative work experience
You are familiar with a programming language; SQL and/or Python a plus

Logistical Details

Internship terms: Summer or Fall 202
This is a paid internship program

Los Angeles based Internet Brands is looking for a Quality Assurance Intern to be part of the QA team. This position has great potential for learning and advancement.

Quality Assurance Interns will be responsible for executing black box testing on a number of web-based projects under the guidance of senior QA team members. They will be trained in the company’s Quality Assurance process and be given opportunities to contribute to the creation of test cases and scripts.

The ideal candidate will have a background in computer science, meticulous attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and strong written and verbal communication skills. A degree in Computer Science or web development experience is strongly encouraged, but is not required. Prior quality assurance experience or software development experience is a plus.

Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Buildertrend is looking for a UX Research Intern who will help elevate the practice of research with creative but rigorous qualitative, quantitative, and/or design research methods. The right candidate will be an effective communicator, passionate about understanding people, curious about the relationship between data, technology and society, comfortable in a flat, fast-moving organization, and a great collaborator. You will help with large research projects (generative and evaluative) and support the research efforts of the larger product team of designers, product analysts, and developers.

Responsibilities

Conduct research studies by applying methods such as usability testing, interviews, field research, surveys, and diary studies

Generate insights that shape how product teams think about medium and long-term product strategy
Work cross-functionally with design, product, data science, content strategy, engineering, and marketing
Combining qualitative and quantitative customer insights to generate strategic and tactical insights along with actionable recommendations

Analytical, project management, and problem-solving experience

As a partner in our customers’ success, our team provides unmatched support, every step of the way. At Buildertrend, we believe in providing an all-in-one solution to solve real problems, deliver real results, and change the way the world builds.

Founded in Omaha in 2006, Buildertrend is quickly becoming the industry standard. Buildertrend is changing the way the world builds. Using technology to bring all parties together, Buildertrend has quickly become the product of the future. The innovative solutions and team atmosphere are what makes Buildertrend one of the hottest employers in Omaha. If you want to learn more about us, check out: http://buildertrend.com/about.aspx.

If you would like to make a direct impact with a multi-billion Fortune 500 global leader in flooring fashions; while making the world a better place, then we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Mohawk Industries is a leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 276489

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
The Supply Chain Collaboration team is one of the fastest growing teams within the SAP Business Network, the largest business-to-business network in the world with over 3.6 million connected companies in over 190 countries. Our solution enables customers to manage and run an efficient supply chain and helps them collaborate with direct materials suppliers through innovative planning and execution processes. We are looking for bright engineers who are passionate about solving complex business problems with purposeful and beautiful software and have fun while doing it.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP Ariba iXp Intern – Full Stack Developer
Location: Palo Alto, CA
Expected start date to end date: June 2021 – August 2021

In this role, you’ll:
  • Have the unique opportunity to work on innovation/prototyping projects that will enhance the Supply Chain Collaboration offering
  • Design and develop pixel-perfect UI, robust APIs, and scalable microservices for the cloud
  • Gain insight in how enterprise customers manage and run their supply chain on the SAP Business Network
Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

  • Candidates must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent
  • Strong desire to revolutionize the enterprise application space by building beautiful and purposeful cloud solutions for business users
  • Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, ability to articulate technical challenges and solutions clearly
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with Angular, Microservices (Springboot), Kafka, JIRA, IntelliJ IDEA, JMeter, Jenkins, Github
WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Full Job Description

Product Design Intern

Estimated Internship Start Dates: Summer 2021, Fall 2021, Spring 2022, Summer 2022

Location: Houston, Texas (onsite 5-days a week – no remote work available)

Paid Internship: Yes

Company Background

PCS Software, Inc. is an AI platform for the transportation logistics marketspace providing the trucking industry’s most effective transportation management platform (TMP) to improve fleet management and delivery systems and increase profits for our customers. Through innovation and invention, our software individualizes work routines, consolidates workflows, and streamlines management controls to improve accountability, transparency, and eliminate costly and redundant manual processes.

Trucking companies and freight brokers trust PCS to optimize their dispatch, accounting, and fleet operations. TL, LTL, Intermodal, and freight brokerage services use our TMP to automate operations, easily access information, and reduce inefficiencies to maximize sales and revenue. Founded in 1997 and located in Houston, Texas, PCS Software is the leading developer of hosted software solutions designed specifically for the ground transportation industry.

Job Description: Product Design Intern

PCS is currently looking for Product Design Interns in Houston, Texas, with visual design skills and an understanding of user experience who want to help create products that change the way people use transportation management system platforms.

The design and user experience drive what we do. At PCS Software, Inc. the mission of design is to envision the mobile experience and bring that to life in a way that is useful, usable, and desirable. In a design role with PCS, you will be doing more than making things look good. You will be tasked with solving complex problems in a way that is intuitive and easy to use for everyday people. You will be working with other designers, developers, product managers, and customers throughout the design process —from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes.

We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an immediately impact on the way millions of people ship and receive goods. The PCS Software Inc. software engineering team is revolutionizing the way companies use transportation management system platforms.

About You

We are looking for a designer who relentlessly pursues solutions —not just for beautiful design, but also for a seamless user experience as well.  The right candidate will have a genuine passion for web and mobile technologies, understand modern design tools, and user experience.  

What We Look for in Candidates

You need to have depth and breadth. Depth is critical for understanding ownership and how much work you put into an end-to-end experience. We want evidence that you have both thought about a design beyond prints and visuals and have considered all the complex pieces that go into making products. PCS Product Design interns will have three areas of focus that include motion, visual, and interaction design.

Motion Designer:

§ Create motion studies for enhancing usability, interaction, storytelling, and delight.

§ Work closely with UX partners and product managers to ideate and define.

§ Work closely with engineering to integrate into products.

§ Work closely with research to test and inform user experiences.

Visual Designer:

§ Produce quality design that accurately reflect a visual design language or brand guideline.

§ Understand of typography, color, grid, and composition. Demonstrate best practices for pixel-perfect production considerations and methods.

§ Use a broad range of style that can be consistently executed with an aesthetic personality or voice that is consistent, though not restricting.

§ Develop and communicate underlying concepts that inspire design implementation.

Interaction Designer:

§ Produce and test interaction flows and mocks that accurately communicate product functionality to product, engineering, and visual design team members.

§ Pair research with an intellectual curiosity that encourages testing and iteration is essential.

§ Understand modern web and/or mobile environments such as HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Android UI, and iOS UI, as well as how the technologies of each can be used to further enhance the overall experience.

§ Appreciate aesthetic details.

QUALIFICATIONS

§ Currently enrolled as a junior or a senior in a full-time degree program or a 2020 recent graduate with a 3.5 GPA or higher.

§ Currently pursuing a BA/BS/MA/MS degree in graphic design, human-computer interaction, computer science, or related field and graduating in 2021, 2022, or recently graduated in 2020.

§ A design portfolio that demonstrates design principles for web and/or mobile platforms.

§ Proficient in Figma and Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, and In Vision and an eagerness to learn new tools.

§ Demonstrable proficiency with design tools (Adobe Photoshop, Sketch, Illustrator, After Effects, Quartz Composer, Framer Studio, etc.) and familiarity with front- end engineering and/ or working with engineers.

§ Ability to apply brand visual assets in a user interface context and understanding of user-centered design principles.

§ Solid analytical, creative, and visual thinker with excellent communication skills, both verbal and visual.

§ Strong design background in fundamentals along with relevant internship work, work experience, or personal project experience outside the classroom in interaction, graphic design, or motion design.

SUCCESS FACTORS

PCS Software is a company of motivated employees from a wide range of industries and backgrounds working toward a common goal – the success of our customers in the ground transportation industry. Our team works together and challenges each other to bring new ideas to the table to achieve our mission. That is, to create the most effective transportation management system in the country at delivering process improvements that immediately result in operational efficiencies and revenue generation for our customers.

§ Solid track record of longevity at one company and the ability to show growth in your career progression.

§ At a personal and interpersonal level, we are looking for individuals who thrive and excel in teams and demonstrate big-picture thinking, willingness to explore new avenues, be persistent when things do not go well, and be committed to delivering and maintaining a high “Do/Say” ratio.

§ Strong communication skills, both oral and written, at the technical and managerial level, are also key to success.

§ Ability to communicate with customers to understand and document the simulation requirements, then ideate, plan, develop, and deliver simulation tools are required.

§ Skill and ability to: collect, curate, organize, synthesize and/or analyze data to summarize findings and develop conclusions and evidence-based recommendations are essential.

OUR VALUES

Our guiding principle at PCS Software is customer service. We believe that we are a customer service company that happens to make the best software in our industry. If you are driven to delight customers and treat every fellow employee with that same level of excellence and care, then we want to talk to you!

At PCS Software, we value our amazing people-centric culture of builders and doers over any skill that someone can offer. This is an amazing place to work and we offer our team a creative, fun, educational, and challenging environment. We constantly focus on not only the customer’s journey and experience with PCS Software, but our individual journey as employees and the overall team experience as well.

Why Join PCS?

PCS Software, Inc. rewards your hard work with excellent opportunities for career growth and personal development. If you want to be the newest member of a vibrant group of energized technology leaders in an innovative and entrepreneurial environment, then apply online today to start building solutions that customers will love to use and join a company that truly rewards your hard work and values your talented contributions. If you would like to compete for this highly sought-after position, please submit your resume.

PCS Software, Inc. is considered one of the best places to work because of our competitive compensation plans, comprehensive benefits plan with 100% company paid medical, dental, and vision premiums for full-time employees and their dependents, 401k with a 4% match, generous PTO package, a truly creative and fun working environment, complementary food/beverages in the office, paid training and development opportunities, paid gym/fitness facility membership, employee recognition programs, amazing opportunities for career growth, and personal development.

Work Authorization

PCS Software, Inc. will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

This job description provides many examples of the types of responsibilities required but is in not intended to be a comprehensive list. The incumbent will complete other job responsibilities as needed which are not specifically described in this document.

description:
Full Job Description
Company Overview
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.
Opportunity Overview
The Job

WarnerMedia seeks an Intern for the MSC - Media Software Engineer department.

The Media Supply Chain’s Business Technology Systems team is responsible for developing an array of platforms that enable our business users to schedule features and promotional material on all WarnerMedia networks, including HBO Max. Our systems guarantee that content is scheduled within the bounds of our legal rights to utilize those programs, while also ensuring that our programs are properly promoted on our networks with the visually stunning creative marketing for which WarnerMedia is famous.

We seek an intern with experience in software design and development who is looking to gain exciting real-world software engineering experience at a thriving company. This program will have our interns work side-by-side, virtually this year, with the team’s software engineers while we develop new features and functionality for our users and business partners. They will be a contributing part of all of our team’s daily status and weekly planning meetings, along with any design and problem-solving activities the team conducts.

We frequently work in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The ideal intern for this environment will be enthusiastic and collaborative and has a sincere desire for learning and growth.

Application Deadline: Monday, June 14th

The Daily

Develop software in modern enterprise-class languages and development platforms and new emerging technologies as appropriate
Agile/Scrum process participation and process improvement
Capable of working in a collaborative team environment
Can critically evaluate code as a method of learning, and knows when and how to safely refactor code/artifact

The Essentials

Currently enrolled in a degree program in a Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in a small team environment
Ability to work in a remote environment
Experience programming in Java. Experience in Node.js, Angular, AWS, Unix, SQL, MongoDB is a plus.
Looking for energetic and “go-getter” personalities

Internship Program

Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Fall 2021 program dates are Sept 20th - Dec 10th 12; must be available for full program duration.
Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (40 hours/week) for full program duration.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
This position is targeted toward upperclassmen and graduate students.

The Perks

Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Backend Software Developer - Intern

Amply Power is a clean energy technology company going after an emerging $100B market opportunity. AMPLY deploys and operates EV chargers the way data centers operate server blades - lots of them at a time, with high efficiency, low cost, and 99.99% uptime. We serve public sector and commercial businesses with fleet vehicles - electric buses, trucks, and passenger fleets. Amply Power is focused on transforming the commercial transportation sector by removing the challenges, surprises, and learning curve that fleet operators often face when switching to electricity as a fuel.

We’re looking for product-oriented engineers who are passionate about building great backend services in a fast-paced, high-growth, early-stage start-up environment. Our engineers are encouraged to be autonomous, solving open-ended problems and maximizing their own growth. The Backend Software Developer will be responsible for developing and maintaining the software that runs on our electric vehicle charging stations and for the interfaces between stations and cloud-based services.

While this posting is listed for SF Bay Area, CA, we are open to hiring throughout the US.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Designing and building backend solutions from the ground up.
  • Assist in test setups (physical charging station setups), test plans, documentation of monitoring error codes, and product features.
  • You will work across teams to build and collaborate on product requirements for the next generation of world-class EV technology products.
  • Building large-scale Node.JS applications in real-time, event-driven, distributed/transactional cloud/IoT platforms.
  • Collaborate with leads, developers, and designers to create new features and maintain back-end architectures for highly trafficked applications.
  • Fix software defects/bugs, measure and analyze code for quality and test coverage.
  • Ensure proper technical design and documentation.
  • Writing high-quality code for production and master the art of code quality.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
  • 2+ years of professional experience with backend development (preferably in node.js).
  • Experience with micro-services architectures and building scalable backend APIs.
  • Demonstrated experience maintaining continuous delivery pipelines.
  • Experience with Docker containerization and container orchestration
  • Self-starter has worked highly independently.
  • Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills

Additional Awesomeness

  • Experience with Java, AWS and/or distributed systems is a plus.
  • Prior experience working at startups and/or on consumer-facing products.
  • IoT / control system domain experience is an asset, ideally in the Electric Vehicle / charging platform space.

Agfa HealthCare, is a division of the Agfa-Gevaert Group which is headquartered in Mortsel, Belgium and traded on Euronext Brussels (AGFB).

From product development to implementation, our unified Enterprise Imaging Platform is purpose-built to reduce complexity, improve productivity and deliver clinical value. We use our proven track record as an innovator, our in-depth medical knowledge and our strategic guidance to help healthcare providers achieve their clinical, operational and business strategies.

The Healthcare IT Staging Intern will assist the Staging Engineer in implementing project designs and creation of integrated turn-key IT solutions through Agfa processes, IMS procedures and product guidelines to facilitate the delivery of quality services to the customer or our Agfa regional service teams. Install in racks and configure servers from Oracle, HPE, and others, as well as map out, run, and connect all LAN and SAN network cabling and hardware.
Deploys advanced healthcare IT solutions based on standard high availability and site disaster recovery scenarios.

Full Job Description
United States

Position Description

Volvo Group Trucks Technology (GTT), a division of Volvo Group North America, provide state-of-the-art research, engineering, product planning and project execution to final delivery of complete vehicles.

Position Description Summary:
We are currently looking for a motivated and self-driven student to work within our Testing Technology department during the summer. Testing Technology is a department within Features, Verification and Validation (FVV), a group that works with testing and simulation of Complete Vehicles for Volvo Trucks and Mack Trucks in North America. The student should be prepared to work in a challenging and fast-paced environment; gaining experience and knowledge in various aspects of engineering. As a valued member of the Testing Technology Group within GTT, the student will have the opportunity to work directly with the Volvo Trucks Test Engineers. GTT’s goal is to contribute to the student’s development, as well as providing an opportunity for the student to work in a business environment within the manufacturing industry. This position will report directly to the Testing Technology Group Manager.

Core Responsibilities:
The candidate will have a mentor assigned to them and oversee their daily tasks and provide required support throughout the semester
The candidate will work directly with the data analytics engineers focusing on the following items:
Development of internal planning tool for resource allocation and visualization in VBA
Database querying and support development internal asset tracking tool for test equipment
Setup and configuration of custom-made Power BI dashboards according to internal requests
Assist test engineers with script conversion from Matlab to Python
Support development of internal Field Test Python Library in collaboration with data analytic engineers
Support development and tracking of data quality and data movement dashboard
It is preferable that the candidate have experience with the following:
Matlab, Python, SQL, VBA, Power BI or any other scripting language
Microsoft Office Suite
Previous experience with time series data from measurement sensors
Basic understanding of data report generation and visualization.

Duration:
This internship will require 30 hours per week during the fall semester 2021. Interns will be expected to spend a large part of the time working in the Greensboro shop/office. However, due to the unpredictable nature of the ongoing pandemic, the manager may approve the intern to work a portion of their time from home. This internship will require location in Greensboro, NC for the duration of the internship.
Internship will run from August through December, 2021.

Essential Skills and Required Experience:
Applicant must be currently enrolled and pursuing a Computer Science or similar degree and have completed 30 semester hours of undergraduate studies prior to the start of the internship
Applicants must have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 at the time of application
Ability to generate source code and scripts including troubleshooting of existing applications
Previous experience developing data reports and dashboards
Great problem-solving skills and a basic understanding of automotive is preferred
Strong communication skills and ability to work in teams
Detailed oriented. Collects data and deliver detailed reports
Flexible. Willing to engage in a wide variety of tasks and positively accepts changes in priorities
Valid US Work authorization

Personal Competencies:
Service oriented mindset
Team player with the ability to adjust to new situations and stakeholder needs
Ability to work effectively with peers from all areas of the organization
Works with integrity and instills trust
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
Engaged and proactively seeks knowledge
Ability to use various mechanic tools and lift up to 30 lbs

About us

The Volvo Group drives prosperity through transport solutions, offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers’ uptime and productivity. Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to shaping the future landscape of sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions. Countless career opportunities are offered across the group’s leading brands - Volvo, Volvo Penta, Terex Trucks, SDLG, Renault Trucks, Prevost, Nova Bus, Mack, Eicher, Dongfeng Trucks and Arquus.

Volvo Group Trucks Technology provides Volvo Group Trucks and Business Area's with state-of-the-art research, cutting-edge engineering, product planning and purchasing services, as well as aftermarket product support. With Volvo Group Trucks Technology you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other and embrace change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.

We'll need you to gather, analyze, and visualize data with the end goal of maximizing profits and increasing our efficiency. Currently pursuing a bachelors or masters degree in or related to Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology and Information Systems.
Working knowledge of various analytics platforms & business support applications such as MS Office (Word, Power Point, Excel, Project, Power BI) required
Excellent understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms
Ability to work independently and multi-task with minimal supervision
Must be dependable, pay attention to detail and show strong initiative and drive
Proficiency in handling quantitative data and analysis of data

Ability to understand and find appropriate applications for data and analysis results
Very forward-thinking (3.5+ GPA required) undergrad or grad student who will be graduating in December 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered)
Excellent analytical skills and strong knowledge of Excel (exp. with VLOOKUP's, Pivot Tables, etc.)

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

General:
MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

position: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 286555
Work Area: Software-Development Operations
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Project:
The SAP Internship Experience Project is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Project in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
The SAP Digital Platforms team, within SAP’s Intelligence Enterprise Solutions group, is responsible for SAP.com and associated external (public-facing) digital web properties. The SAP Digital Platforms team is responsible for the development lifecycle, continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices, and overall operational support for 47 country sites globally in 23 languages.

The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is a detail-oriented, in-house services team that is constantly pushing the envelope by working within our creative and technical boundaries to encourage internal customers to build the best user-experiences and blazing-fast websites.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected start date to end date: June - December 2021

In this role, you’ll:
The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is looking for an Intern to assist the Speed Performance Monitoring Lead to collaborate with the design, development, and other operational leads for SAP‘s digital landscapes. Our on-going objective to improve the online responsiveness of our user-experience on desktop and mobile web browsers in support of SAP’s 2021 Mobile-First strategy.

This role is responsible for assisting in the management of SAP.com and other digital entities including communications, content and assets for various areas of the global website and digital programs. The position provides a main point of contact for assigned requests, driving projects to completion through close collaboration with core platform team members, leadership, and assigned third-party agencies to ensure efficient and timely production of a high-quality digital customer experience.

Who you are:
We're looking for a self-motivated, out-of-the-box thinker who enjoys challenges across a broad range of technology subject areas, is pursuing a career in Computer Science, Front-End Web Development, or User-Experience Design with knowledge and interest in performance and optimization, front-end development, interactive design, application performance industry, and enterprise level projects.

Responsibilities

Audit websites for performance, identify optimization opportunities, and present the results in the cross-functional team environment.
Work in a collaborative environment developing and executing against immediate and long-term incremental programs.
Make effective tradeoffs considering business priorities, but always with the user-experience in mind.
Advise web engineering teams on key technical performance and optimization considerations and best practices.
Work with Data/Analytics team on ensure assets are trackable for reporting and insights initiatives.
Profile performance of JavaScript and layouts for a multitude of devices/platforms.
Work with partners (e.g.: Adobe, Splunk, Google, and other third-party web services) and consulting agencies to ensure each site release or initiative delivers maximum impact to customers across all websites and data platforms.
Generate performance reports, competitive analysis, and benchmarks for internal partners using our best-in-class performance and optimization tool-sets.
Build out and report on synthetic tests with Splunk (a.k.a. Rigor) Synthetic Testing platform.
Build out available real-user monitoring test reports with SAP.com Development Team.
Analyze performance metrics and build plans for improvements with development leads.
Provide an unparalleled customer experience by contributing to new features and technical documentation.
Assist with discovering and debugging issues found on web properties.
Find areas we can optimistically render UI without waiting on a server response.
Police and standardize performance budgets, health-checks, scorecards, and KPIs directed by your main point of contact.
Monitor and measure complex multi-step user flows on our customers’ websites and applications using a full browser and a script recorder.
Track mobile and desktop experiences and performance over time using pre-determined, industry standard network connections.
Monitor and optimize third-party tags and identify slow and error-causing external script risks.
Run tests with highly customizable configurations on any device type, connection speed or viewport
Develop, share, and set the bar within SAP for high quality in web performance engineering.
Assist in the support of planning and project management.
Assist building internal webpages in SAP JAM, Microsoft Teams, and other wiki-based platforms for documentation and communication in support of SAP’s Speed Performance Monitoring program.
Help organize projects in accordance with requirements.
Assist with SAP.com agile ceremonies and planning.
Leverage tools and technology for SAP.com content and asset production.
Have very good communication skills and enjoy communicating challenging technical concepts.
Measure and A/B test site performance solutions.
Mentor, educate and advocate for web performance across our teams.

Qualifications

General knowledge of web speed performance metrics.
General familiarity with Internet technologies and how the web works.
General knowledge of industry standard web speed performance tools; e.g.: WebPageTest.org, Google Pagespeed Insights, and Google Lighthouse.
General to Intermediate knowledge, approx. 1-2 years, of general web technologies experience; e.g.: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Java/C#/PHP.
Intermediate knowledge of Google Core Web Vitals strategy and metric threshold requirements.
Intermediate knowledge of visual design principles and commonly used tools for optimizing visual page elements; e.g.: images and media.
Have the ability to read and understand code, explore new technologies, and APIs.
General knowledge of modern browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
General knowledge of project management and, issue tracking and documentation tools; e.g.: JIRA, Confluence, MS Teams, Slack, etc.
Proficiency with converting JSON to MS Excel for in-depth speed performance reporting.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs; including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Comfortable working with a geographically-distributed software development team.
Willingness to acquire new skills to meet evolving needs.
Passion and interest in web performance optimization to improve an website’s user-experience across all web devices, internet connection speeds, and geo-locations.
Exceptional organizational and planning skills and a proven ability to multi-task.
General knowledge of Agile methodologies.
General understanding of content management systems such as WordPress or Adobe AEM.
Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills.
Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy and quality.
Ability to prioritize effectively to manage multiple projects.
Experience working in a team environment as well as independently.
Ability to collaborate across teams globally.
Ability to complete tasks in a timely manner.
Strong desire to continually learn new technologies.

Technical Experience

A basic knowledge is required for this internship.

Intermediate expertise is required for future employment opportunities.

Full-stack Development
HTML5/CSS3
JavaScript
JavaScript Frameworks
jQuery
DevTools
Responsive/Adaptive Design
Cross-Browser Development
Content Management Systems
Testing/Debugging
Git/Version Control

Bonus Skills:
Solid hands-on understanding of Google Analytics, CDNs and custom HTTP headers.
Intermediate knowledge of advanced web performance profiling tools; e.g.: GTmetrix, Pingdom, SpeedCurve, Rigor, etc.
Experience optimizing React applications.
Knowledge of code splitting and simplification methods.

Education and Professional Experience

In pursuit of degree in a related field or equivalent work experience; such topics of interests are:
Computer Science
Web Performance Analytics
Full Stack Web Development
Front-End Web Development
User-Experience Design
Interactive Design and Media
Marketing & Business
Relevant experience in study or similar position managing production processes and workflow.
Relevant experience in study or similar position monitoring quality assurance testing environments and live production systems.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!
