Full Job Description
At Carta Healthcare , we believe in a multidisciplinary approach to solving problems. Our mission is to automate and simplify the work that burns out clinical staff, so they can focus on patient care. Our AI Enabled Technology offers a complete solution (people, process and technology) to support the Healthcare Registry Data Market. We design products that transform the way hospitals use data to deliver care. We make analyzing data fast, easy, and useful for everyone. We give clinicians time back to focus on research and care that improve patient lives by reducing paperwork. Carta Healthcare is a remote organization with headquarters in San Francisco and Portland, Oregon. To learn more about our AI Enabled Solutions and more about our company, please visit www.carta.healthcare

We are looking for a Data Science Intern responsible for analyzing trends in our data, then writing small algorithms to auto-populate data from our knowledge graph. For example, when trying to automate a field asking whether a patient was on a ventilator during their time in the ICU, you will analyze the data in our knowledge graph for potential answers. Then you will write a bot that takes in the various data and determines if the patient is on the ventilator at the same time as their ICU stay. Other bots use Carta's Natural Language Processing (NLP) pipeline to extract medical concepts from unstructured clinical notes. In addition to writing these bots, you will work closely with our engineering team to learn about the cutting edge of data engineering in healthcare.

You love solving complex engineering problems by understanding trends in the data. You're a positive individual who cultivates conceptual thinking and brings a curiosity and experimental approach to solving engineering challenges. You enjoy building new features and writing elegant code. If this describes you, then you belong at Carta!

Responsibilities:
Write code to translate data from our FHIR knowledge graph to autofill forms
Use Carta's NLP pipeline to extract actionable insights from clinical notes
Work with our clinical staff to understand the data
Explore, process, and validate data
Create reusable code, libraries, and plug-ins for future use
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders

What you'll need:
Degree in Biomedical Informatics, Statistics, Computer Science or related field
Experience working with clinical data
Strong understanding of the core principles of statistical/machine learning
Python expertise (3+ years experience)
Postgres or SQL expertise
Job is remote but candidates must be US-based
Familiarity with Jupyter notebooks or other data science tools
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools (i.e. git)
A detail-focused, analytical approach to solving problems
Excellent communication skills and experience in collaborative environments
The desire to be continually learning about emerging technologies/industry trends

Why we love Carta Healthcare, and why you will too!

Industry leading products
Work hard, and have fun doing it
Work alongside some of the most talented and dedicated teammates
Mission driven

Full Job Description

We have several opportunities open for full stack development work.

We are a creator content platform focusing on AR/VR projects based in Southern California, seeking a unpaid part-time intern as our Full Stack Developer Lead to help with the following projects:

  • Re-design of a website and community network as well as accompanying app using Buddy Boss and Elementor.
  • Build our own custom dashboard on AWS / S3 with various API connections -- but this is a project that will take a bit longer that's happening in tandem.
  • We service an indie label client looking to build their own custom dashboard for 1) collection of big data (both qualitative and quantitative) from third-party sources, 2) communications between various permission based levels, 3) asset management, and 4) project management.

Please be aware as a self-funded / bootstrapped startup, we do not have any developers on staff currently -- so we are looking for someone to be proactive and really take a lead. We have considered hiring a few people so that there is support in troubleshooting and executing tasks.

As mentioned, this is an UNPAID internship so please do not apply if you're seeking a paid opportunity.

Our internships are offered online and for-credit / experience only -- and there are two options:

  • Candidates may be enrolled in a college or university, and if offered an internship, students must provide a letter from their college or university confirming that they will receive school credit. The minimum time commitment is 6 to 10 hours per week over 2 to 3 days per week.
  • Candidates are also invited to apply as industry professionals (whether recent grads or experienced developers) looking to volunteer time and effort as a cool side-project, career pivot, or simply to gain experience.

If you take this internship, you will work closely with both the founder as well as those in marketing and product/services management to define and develop streamlined workflows that will allow the company to efficiently apply, augment, and enhance what we offer both internally & across the web.

We integrate our interns as members of our Scrum/Agile teams where they participate in our weekly product / service planning meetings. We are looking for interns with experience in:

  • REST APIs: researching and implementing developer tooling
  • Product UI: sourcing and working with feeds (JSON/XML) that populate dashboards
  • Familiarity with AR/VR
  • Storage: cloud data storage and retrieval
  • Compute: distributed workload management and scheduling
  • Query: query language development and application
  • Deployments: systems to support continuous delivery and integration of new software features - across multiple platforms (mobile, desktop)
  • E-commerce: customer onboarding, billing integration, account management services

We will provide structure, definition of goals, process, relationships, community, and teamwork experiences to give interns the best chance to succeed at their projects

What You Bring to the Table:

  • In progress (Junior or Senior) or recently completed Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or participation in a relevant coding bootcamp, or equivalent work experience
  • Experience developing business applications using object-oriented programming languages (ie: Java, Python, PHP or Ruby) and experience with JavaScript frameworks like Angular, React, Node.js
  • Knowledge of MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL
  • Experience with AWS / cloud platforms, including Kubernetes, OpenShift, Docker Enterprise, or Cloud Foundry in the public cloud
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • You’re driven towards projects that have an impact on user experience
  • You are problem-solver who is interested in scale, efficiency, and performance optimization
  • Technical curiosity and a strong desire to learn and improve
  • A strong interest in creator content and/or the entertainment industry -- knowledge of the audience is helpful in these projects

Bonus points:

  • You have public code viewable on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
  • You’ve developed visually appealing front end website architecture, including translating designer mock-ups and wireframes into front-end code
  • You’ve designed user interactions on web pages
  • You’ve developed functional databases, applications, and servers to support websites on the back end
  • You have a desire to leverage data and algorithms to improve the search experience for our users and customers.

We Want You to Have:

  • Excellent communication, problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills
  • Ability to present and clearly explain your work to others
  • Experience collaborating in multifunctional teams
  • Ability to set goals, socialize them for approval, and work quickly & independently
  • Affinity with our values, and a passion for creating products that meet people’s functional and emotional needs

What You’ll Get in Return:

  • Experiential Education: A rare hands-on opportunity to help launch two new platforms each with different focuses but across projects, you would have focuses in creator content, artist management, rights management, & AR/VR technologies.
  • Networking with a dedicated team of passionate and dedicated individuals in the space including music industry veterans to create life-long contacts and quality referrals within the industry.

Program Guidelines:

  • Internship dates: Summer - 2021

Why You Want To Work Here:

  • A small but collaborative and creative team
  • The opportunity to gain a further understanding of Agile music marketing models across platforms, campaign / activation planning via a regular (monthly) release schedule / calendar, and the marketing lifecycle from ideation to execution to measurement.

Weekly Responsibilities / Requirements:

  • Zoom video “Scrum”-type calls for weekly work Sprints (45 min – 1 to 2 times a week)
  • Proficient with shared project management apps: (e.g. - Slack, G-Suite (docs, slides, sheets), Asana, Miro).

Application Instructions:

  • Submit a resume/CV & short, concise paragraph stating why you’re interested in the opportunity, with links to your previous work / code projects / websites. Being detail oriented is key -- please check spelling and grammer. If there are any assessments, please complete them.

This is the primary project seeking the development at this moment, but happy to discuss the other opportunities on a call as well -- if you feel the multitude of portfolio builders and experience would be beneficial to you.

Pay: $1.00 - $2.00 per month

Education:

Experience:

  • REST API and Having Set Up Advanced Integrations: 2 years (Required)
  • JavaScript frameworks such as Angular JS, React, and Amber.: 2 years (Required)
  • Server-side languages such as Python, Ruby, Java, & .Net.: 2 years (Required)
  • Database technology such as MySQL, Oracle, and MongoDB.: 2 years (Required)

position: Office of Data Governance and Analysis Evictions Study Intern
description:
Full Job Description

Do you enjoy problem solving, quantitative reasoning, and technology? Are you interested in working in a collaborative, friendly mission-oriented environment? If so, we invite you to consider an* internship *with the Office of Data Governance and Analysis (ODGA) team at the Legal Services Corporation!

Established by Congress in 1974, the Legal Services Corporation (LSC) is the country’s single largest funder of civil legal aid for low-income Americans. LSC currently funds 132 independent nonprofit legal aid organizations with more than 800 offices throughout the nation. LSC’s mission is to promote equal access to justice and provide grants for high-quality civil legal assistance to low-income Americans.

ODGA is responsible for supporting other internal business units with a broad range of data and analytical projects. We use a variety of software applications to examine statistical and administrative data and develop visualizations to share findings with our internal stakeholders and civil legal aid community. We build products and knowledge to help the access to justice community make better, data-driven decisions.

LSC is seeking applicants local to the DC area. Depending on the status of Covid-19 related telework in the Summer, the internship may be fully remote, partially in-person, or fully in-person. If LSC returns to in-person work, the intern will have the option to report to the LSC office.

BASIC FUNCTION:

The primary objectives of the internship are for the intern to:

1. Build problem-solving and quantitative reasoning skills while working in a collaborative, mission-oriented environment; and

2. Hone project management skills while working on a congressionally funded project concerning eviction.

The intern's hours may be up to 20 hours per week. The internship will run from May/June through August 2021, with the potential to extend through the Fall on a part-time basis. Candidates interested in an extended internship are encouraged to apply.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

The intern's principal duties and responsibilities include:

1. Verify and query collected administrative court data using SQL.

2. Developing data visualizations using Tableau and other applications.

3. Conducting bibliographic searches of current research relating to eviction and housing.

4. Conducting research and writing brief summaries of findings for publication or program evaluation.

5. Addressing periodic requests for data/literature.

COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:

General:

LSC is accepting applications from current undergraduate or graduate students studying Urban Planning, Political Science, Sociology, Computer Science, Data Science, or other related fields. Excellent communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and quantitative reasoning are required. The ideal candidate will be curious, hard-working, and disciplined.

Technical/Specialized:

Proficiency with data visualization software is required, and proficiency with statistical software is also required. Knowledge of project management tools, specifically Trello, is preferred.

HOURLY RATE:

This position is paid on an hourly basis in accordance with the following rate schedule:

Class Year

Hourly Rate

1st year

$15.00

2nd year

$16.00

3rd year

$17.00

4th year

$18.00

APPLICATION PROCESS:

Submit a complete application (provide ALL of the information requested and answer ALL of the questions) and attach a résumé and cover letter explaining why you are a good fit for this position. Incomplete applications will not be considered. Apply directly on our website at: https://www.lsc.gov/about-lsc/careers.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION STATEMENT:

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion. Our differences fuel excellence, and we strive to create an environment where every individual is valued and feels empowered to bring their full, authentic self to work. We are building a community rooted in openness and trust where colleagues have the resources to grow, thrive and fully contribute to achieving equal access to justice.

LSC is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Internship

Pay: $15.00 - $18.00 per hour

Schedule:

Description

BOMBARDIER

At Bombardier, our employees work together to evolve mobility worldwide - one good idea at a time. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.

With an average of over 300 sunny days per year, Bombardier Business Aircraft’s Tucson Service Center is surrounded by stunning mountain ranges and desert landscapes. Celebrating over 40 years of operations in Tucson, Arizona, the service center occupies almost 1 million sq ft of total hangar space and is the largest of Bombardier’s nine aircraft service centers. The facility services both Bombardier commercial and business aircraft. Since its inauguration in 1976, the facility has been located at Tucson International Airport, a strategic location and a key local partner. The 247,000 sq ft Business Aircraft facility is equipped to perform scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, modifications, including interior modifications, avionics installations, customized exterior paint, and Aircraft on Ground (AOG) support for Bombardier Learjet, Challenger and Global aircraft. The Service Center has received certifications from CAAC, FAA, EASA, Argentina (Military), Bermuda, Canada, Cayman Islands, Hong Kong, India, Mexico, Qatar and South Africa.

Bombardier has an exciting opportunity available for a Mechanical Engineer Intern based in Tucson, AZ.

In your role, you will:
  • Assist with interpreting customer specifications, vendor requirements, company/industry standards, FAA/DOT and foreign regulations
  • Assist with determining mechanical equipment, hardware, antenna and system requirements in all types of Bombardier aircraft
  • Assist with investigating design build issues and help develop structural engineering solutions
  • Release temporary engineering to resolve build issues in a timely manner
  • Assist in dispositioning aircraft non-conformances including rework instructions
  • Perform aircraft and engineering drawing investigation and coordination with affected engineering disciplines, Quality assurance and operations manufacturing representatives
  • Coordinate with vendors to resolve installation interface and reliability problems
  • Author engineering to define structural special instructions or restrictions
Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

  • You are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace, Mechanical or Computer Science Engineering
Please note: Relocation or housing assistance is not available for this position. No visa sponsorship is available for this position,

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Your ideas move people.

position: Teacher, Assistant, Intern Summer Camps =STEM, Coding, Minecraft, Robotics=
description:
Full Job Description

Summer STEM Teachers, Assistants, Internship (Minecraft, Coding & Robotics)
Hello, and thank you for your interest in our Summer Technology Teacher and Assistant Positions! Below is an overview of the program and positions as well as a few questions to help us determine if you are a good fit for our company.

============== APPLY ONLINE http://bit.ly/3e4ONvU =====================

************************
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
************************

You must be available for 8 weeks this summer from June 8 to August 7. Classes typically run Monday-Thursday with occasional Fridays, and you will need to be available from 8 am to 5 pm. Some classes run in only the morning or just the afternoon, and sometimes both.

As a Teacher or Assistant, you will be driving to your site, typically a school or community education building. You will typically be responsible for bringing 2-3 plastic bins of equipment per class, which you will then be set up in a classroom before students arrive. You will need a vehicle to transport class equipment. Our headquarter location is in Roseville, Minnesota. You will need to go every 1 to 3 weeks to our headquarters for training and equipment pick up and drop off.

Rochester and St. Cloud teachers will only need to go twice in one summer

You will be delivering our curriculum to classes of up to 18 students. Teachers must be comfortable with managing up to 12 students alone. Grade level will vary between K-8th grades depending on the class.

************************
ABOUT PROGRAM:
************************
Tech Academy teaches week-long technology classes throughout the US. We offer classes in Minecraft, Movie Making, Video Game Design, Legos, and Robotics for students ages 6-14. We are seeking enthusiastic applicants for our Summer Camp Technology Teacher and Assistant positions.

Ideal applicants for Teacher positions are college students/graduates with experience with elementary-age children or licensed teachers.

Ideal applicants for Assistant positions are tech-savvy high school or college students, or those qualified for the Lead Teacher position looking for a more relaxed role in the classroom.

Many of our past employees were able to use positions to satisfy an internship requirement from school.

************************
Training and Equipment:
************************
Before teaching or assisting, teachers must complete 12 hours of online training on basic camp management and leadership skills. You must also complete an in-house 12-hour employee orientation.

The curriculum will be provided to each teacher for each class. You are required to go over the curriculum, and submit projects to us prior to teaching. We will available during business hours via phone and email to help you. You will be provided all of the equipment needed to teach a class each week.

************************************
Pay:
************************************
Teachers: $15-$25 an hour
Assistants $12-$16 an hour
Prep and training: $8.25 an hour

************************************
Requirements:
************************************

  • College Student/Graduate majoring in Engineering, Computer Science, Graphic or Visual Arts, Video Game Design or Education
  • Experience with Elementary age children
  • Have a valid driver’s license
  • You will be required to complete a local and national background check
  • Be very comfortable with technology and using computers
  • Your own reliable vehicle that can transport up to 4 large plastic totes
  • Able to lift equipment totes weighing up to 40 pounds
  • You must be very punctual and reliable. Students must always be supervised.
  • You must be organized and efficient to run an effective class
  • You must be self-confident, energetic, creative, and assertive enough to control a class of high energy elementary-age kids
  • You need to be able to work independently and communicate via email and phone with us on a regular basis
  • Patient, positive personality
  • Reliable access to the Internet and a cell phone.

Plusses:
Knowledge of Legos, Minecraft, or both Programming or Robotics experience of any kind

============== APPLY ONLINE http://bit.ly/3e4ONvU =====================

Related keywords: teacher assistant, assistant teacher, teaching assistant, summer jobs, teacher, instructor, internship, STEM

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary, Internship

Pay: $15.00 - $25.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
We will need to follow all current COVID-19 Procedures in place during the summer

Experience:

  • Experience with Children: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

  • Driver's License (Preferred)

Luxottica is a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of fashion, luxury and sports eyewear. Our wholesale network covers more than 150 countries and our retail presence consists of over 9,100 retail stores across the globe.

In North America, our wholesale business is the home to global brands like Ray-Ban, Oakley, and many of the top fashion house brands. Our leading retail brands include; LensCrafters, Sunglass Hut, Pearle Vision, Target Optical and Sears Optical. We are also home to EyeMed, the fastest growing vision care company in the United States.

Supporting over 4,500 retail stores in North America, a career in our retail headquarters allows us to stay in touch with the end customer and use their ever-changing behaviors and preferences to shape our offerings of the best eyewear and services.

GENERAL FUNCTION

The Luxottica Summer Internship Program is a 10-week immersion into Luxottica and its brands. It’s a project-based internship where you will have the opportunity to learn, collaborate, and contribute to business success by working on priority projects. At Luxottica, we love what we do! We are looking for students who share our passion to help the world see and can turn their passion into dedication and focus to deliver great results.

By interning at our North American Headquarters in Mason, OH, you’ll work on projects supporting one or more of our major retail chains: LensCrafters, Pearle Vision, Sears Optical, Target Optical, Sunglass Hut, or EyeMed (one of the largest Vision Care companies).

We are looking for innovative and passionate students to join us as part of the Finance and Accounting Leadership Development Program. The Leadership Development program focuses on meaningful and challenging projects. The program is designed to develop future finance and accounting leaders within Luxottica, offering increased exposure to Leadership and different areas of Luxottica’s Finance and Accounting Organization.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Creates meaningful and accurate reporting that provide insights to the business.
Drives evolution of financial reporting and analytics.
Supports financial managers/ analysts/ leaders and play a partner role on key projects.
Participates in special projects and creates ad hoc analysis.
Participates in LDP program events.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Actively pursuing an undergraduate degree in Business Analytics, Information Technology, Finance, Mathematics, Statics, or related major.
Strong excel skills
Strong blend of analytical and creative problem-solving skills
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Available the full 10-week program, 40 hours per week
Interest in corporate finance & accounting
Ability to multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Rising undergraduate junior or senior
Study abroad or international exposure
Demonstrate leadership ability and relationship building skills

  • Ability to manage multiple assignments of varying complexity on concurrent timelines within deadlines and constraints

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

As part of the Global Partner Engineering team, you will be working on various research projects including technical and market view on SAP’s multiple product lines.

Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Research Executive
Location: Virtual USA
Expected Start Date: June 2021
Contract Duration: 6 to 12 months

In this role, you’ll:
As an intern, your tasks may include:
Market research of ISVs (Independent Software vendors), VAR (Value added resellers) and SI (System Integrators)
Online research and analysis as required for the project
Technology research
Research on various Industry

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or Advertising and Marketing or Law or related fields
Ability to absorb new concepts and apply them for the tasks

Strong work ethic
